thread.title: Uber drivers are employees, labor commissioner says
thread.title_full: Uber drivers are employees, labor commissioner says | OregonLive.com

author: Elliot Njus | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Uber drivers are employees, labor commissioner says
text:
Uber drivers may use their own vehicles and choose when or if they work, but they're still employees under Oregon law, the state's labor commissioner said.
In an advisory opinion issued Wednesday, Bureau of Labor and Industries Commissioner Brad Avakian said Uber drivers are employees because they work for the company's benefit and they're economically dependent on the ride-hailing company.
It follows a similar ruling in California. Uber has contended that its role was connecting private contractors with customers, but the regulatory stance adopted in California and Oregon could mean the drivers are eligible for new benefits and protections under Oregon law.
Avakian said that although Uber drivers use their own vehicles and set their own hours, the company maintains complete control over the rates drivers can charge and the technological infrastructure.
The ruling didn't mention other companies in the so-called "gig economy," where a network of workers provide generally unskilled labor on demand, usually facilitated through an online marketplace. But it could have ramifications for other start-ups with similar business models, like the ride-sharing firm Lyft and the grocery delivery service Instacart.
This post will be updated.
